ImageData.LabelName: b) Fluid or cancer nodules around the lungs or heart
c) Cancer has spread to one place in an organ or tissue not near the lung

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Lightened up the area over the brain, faded the reproductive organs as they aren’t involved in the staging for this cancer, moved the cancer nodule in the pull out and main figure slightly lower so that it borders the heart at a slightly lower place
Diversity updates: Made figure a Hispanic/Latino male, updated skin tone to FP IV, and added more facial features
Changed the label to say "c) Cancer has spread to one place in an organ or tissue not near the lung"; removed the label “Sac around the heart"

Changed the label under the left inset box to say “b) Fluid or cancer nodules around the lungs or heart” and the label for c) to say "Cancer has spread to the lining around the lungs or sac around the heart or to one place in an organ or tissue not near the lung", per reviewer
Put a little box around the cancer spot labelled “a” and put the letter right outside the box
Removed the “a)” from in front of the Primary tumor label

Added a bracket on the right side of the figure that brackets all of the labels starting with “Brain” at the top to “Bone” at the bottom; and added the label “Sac around the heart” above “Adrenal gland”

Changed the label “a) Other lung” to “Primary tumor”; added a letter “a” near the tumor in the other lung (left lung); changed the label next to “c” to say “Lung cancer has spread to one place in an organ or tissue not near the lung”; and • changed the label next to “b” to say “Fluid around the lungs or heart”
New image per AJCC 8th edition staging

Diagnoses.Diagnosis: stage IVA non-small cell lung cancer

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IVA lung cancer; drawing shows a primary tumor in the right lung and (a) a tumor in the left lung. Also shown is (b) fluid or cancer nodules around the lungs or heart (inset), and (c) other organs or tissues where lung cancer may spread, including the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, bone, and distant lymph nodes.

Stage IVA lung cancer; drawing shows a primary tumor in the right lung and (a) a tumor in the left lung. Also shown is (b) fluid or cancer nodules around the lungs or heart (inset), and (c) other organs or tissues where lung cancer may spread, including the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, bone, and distant lymph nodes.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IVA lung cancer. The tumor may be any size and cancer may have spread to the lymph nodes. One or more of the following is found: (a) there are one or more tumors in the lung that does not have the primary tumor; and/or (b) cancer is found in fluid around the lungs or heart or there are cancer nodules in the lining around the lungs or the sac around the heart; and/or (c) cancer has spread to one place in an organ or tissue not near the lung, such as the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, or bone, or to a lymph node that is not near the lung.

Stage IVA lung cancer. The tumor may be any size and cancer may have spread to the lymph nodes. One or more of the following is found: (a) there are one or more tumors in the lung that does not have the primary tumor; and/or (b) cancer is found in fluid around the lungs or heart or there are cancer nodules in the lining around the lungs or the sac around the heart; and/or (c) cancer has spread to one place in an organ or tissue not near the lung, such as the brain, adrenal gland, kidney, liver, or bone, or to a lymph node that is not near the lung.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage IV non-small cell lung cancer
